snippet: Poverty, unemployment and anti-government sentiment in the Jordanian town of Maan have created modest but growing support for Islamic militancy among residents.
abstract: Poverty, unemployment and anti-government sentiment in the Jordanian town of Maan have created modest but growing support for extremist group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; across Arab world, drive for democratic change has stalled, replaced by resurgence of strongmen and militants, both selling promise of stability and order as counterpoints to tumult that followed Arab Spring; for many, radical Sunni jihadis of ISIS are seen as a force battling oppression.
lead_paragraph: Poverty, unemployment and anti-government sentiment in the Jordanian town of Maan have created modest but growing support for Islamic militancy among residents.

headline.main: Jihadis Tug at Edges of a Staunch American Ally
headline.print_headline: Jihadis Tug at Edges of a Staunch American Ally
